test_cases.name: Verify successful login, company selection, and navigation to Tasks page
preconditions: A user account with valid credentials exists.
The user is assigned to at least one company.
The application is accessible at the specified Base URL.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application Base URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page loads successfully, displaying the email input field.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid user email into the email input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The application proceeds to the password entry screen.

test_steps.action: Enter the corresponding valid password into the password input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is correctly entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully authenticated, and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: On the company selection page, locate and click the assigned company name.
test_steps.expected_result: The company is selected, and the main application dashboard loads.

test_steps.action: Click on the 'Action Items' menu item in the navigation.
test_steps.expected_result: A submenu with options including 'Tasks' appears.

test_steps.action: From the submenu, click on the 'Tasks' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The application navigates to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Wait for the 'Manage Tasks' page to load completely.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Tasks' page is displayed, and the 'New Task' button is visible.

test_cases.name: Verify creation of a task with individual team member assignment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in and is on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
The team members to be assigned are pre-existing users in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a task name in the 'Short Task Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly populated in the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the date picker and enter a valid due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered and accepted by the date picker.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter the first pre-existing user's email address.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown populates with the matching user.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user from the dropdown options to select them.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully added to the assignment list.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter the second pre-existing user's email address.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown populates with the matching user.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user from the dropdown options to select them.
test_steps.expected_result: The second user is successfully added to the assignment list.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_cases.name: Verify creation of a task with bulk assignment to 'All Users'
preconditions: User is successfully logged in and is on the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_data.Task_Name: Bulk Assignment Task for All Users

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a task name in the 'Short Task Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly populated in the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered and accepted.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully checked.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_cases.name: Verify task creation with file upload and priority alignment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in and is on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
A Priority with a known name pre-exists in the system.
The file to be uploaded exists at the specified local file path.

test_data.Task_Name: Task with File Upload and Priority

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a Task Name and Due Date.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date fields are populated correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field and enter a pre-existing priority name.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching priority.

test_steps.action: Select the matching priority from the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority is successfully selected and aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens correctly.

test_steps.action: In the document dialog, enter a Document Name.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name is entered into its respective field.

test_steps.action: Ensure the document type is 'File'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'File' document type is selected by default.

test_steps.action: Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full file path to it.
test_steps.expected_result: The file begins to upload, and a progress indicator may be visible.

test_steps.action: Wait for the file to upload completely.
test_steps.expected_result: The file upload completes successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The document dialog closes, and the uploaded file is listed as an attachment on the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created with the alignment and attachment, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_cases.name: Verify task creation with link attachment and huddle alignment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in and is on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
A Huddle with a known name pre-exists in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a Task Name and Due Date.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name and due date fields are populated correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field and enter a pre-existing huddle name.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching huddle.

test_steps.action: Select the matching huddle from the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The huddle is successfully selected and aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens correctly.

test_steps.action: In the document dialog, enter a Document Name.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name is entered into its respective field.

test_steps.action: Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The document type changes to 'Link', and a URL input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
test_steps.expected_result: The URL is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The document dialog closes, and the link is listed as an attachment on the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created with the alignment and link attachment, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_cases.name: Verify creation of multiple tasks sequentially in a single session
preconditions: User has valid credentials for login.
The user session timeout is sufficient to create multiple tasks.
All required test data (users, priorities, etc.) for both tasks pre-exists in the system.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application Base URL and log in with valid credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User is authenticated and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the assigned company.
test_steps.expected_result: The main application dashboard loads.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'Action Items' -> 'Tasks'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Tasks' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button to create the first task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter details for the first task (e.g., with individual assignment).
test_steps.expected_result: All fields for the first task are populated correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The first task is created successfully, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Verify that the 'New Task' button is visible on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
test_steps.expected_result: The button's visibility confirms the user session is active and on the correct page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button again to create the second task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens for the second time.

test_steps.action: Enter details for the second task (e.g., with bulk assignment).
test_steps.expected_result: All fields for the second task are populated correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The second task is created successfully in the same session, and the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
